question: The central Statistical Office (CSO) has started measuring economic growth by gross value-added (GVA) at basic prices, replacing the practice of measuring it by GDP at factor cost. What is the difference between GDP at factor cost and GVA at basic prices?
option1: Production taxes are included and production subsidies excluded from GVA at basic prices
option2: Production taxes are excluded and production subsidies included in GVA at basic prices
option3: Production taxes and production subsidies included in GVA at basic prices
option4: Production taxes and production subsidies excluded from GVA at basic prices
answer: Production taxes are included and production subsidies excluded from GVA at basic prices
explanation: The difference between GDP at factor cost and GVA at basic prices is that production taxes are included and production subsidies excluded from the latter.
